context: The word 'valkoinen' is a Finnish adjective meaning 'white'. It can also refer to people with light-colored skin, in which case it translates to 'Caucasian'. The word declines based on grammatical case and number. For example, 'valkoiset' is the plural nominative form, meaning 'whites', while 'valkoisen' is the genitive singular, meaning 'of white'. The combining form of the word is 'valko-', which can be seen in compounds.
